title: Warren Gatland: Wales gave me an opportunity - I've loved our time together and I'm proud of what we achieved
text:
Warren Gatland on Wednesday thanked Wales and their passionate rugby public for giving him a chance of success, but in truth it is he who should be receiving the gratitude.

Gatland has repaid the Welsh Rugby Union’s 2007 decision to make him their head coach in spades and the most successful era in the country’s professional rugby history will end on Friday.

In 12 years in charge of Wales, Gatland, 56, has changed the country’s entire psyche from a team of plucky underachievers to a side which now expects to beat the best and has done so regularly.

A World Cup third-place play-off with his native New Zealand is not the way Gatland...
description: Warren Gatland on Wednesday thanked Wales and their passionate rugby public for giving him a chance of success, but in truth it is he who should be receiving the gratitude.
